name: Barbara Milligan
text:
I had several small jobs I did not want to burden my son with. He works hard and has his own house to maintain. I asked around if anyone knew a good, reliable handyman. So many are unprofessional, unreliable and lack integrity. I was given Kevin's name and when I researched his website, I was impressed. I will have to admit, I am not easily impressed. I thought, 'very impressive website,' but now let's meet the man. He came out to give me an estimate, on time. He was very professional, and I was again impressed. He responded in a very timely manner (again impressed), and had his quote detailed and moderately priced. He began work on the day he promised, and finished when he promised. He does good quality work, is reliable, is very intelligent, has suggestions to offer, and is respectful. If you have work to be done, he will give you a free estimate, arrive on time, give you a detailed estimate, follow up, etc., because he is ORGANIZED beyond words! He came out and completed my tasks just as he said. He will not only be respectful of you, he will respect your home as well. He will wear shoe covers when he enters your home and clean up and take the trash with him when he leaves! He replaced a door, installed extra shelving in my pantry, replaced by hot water dispenser, installed cabinets over my washer and dryer, and hung my big screen TV on the wall. You may be able to find someone less expensive, but they will also be less professional, less reliable, less experienced, and less respectful of your home. I highly recommend Kevin Kuntz, a man of integrity. To be honest, we don't find too many people these days with integrity, and do we want anything less in our home?

P.S. For the record; I am not related to, a friend of, or have any other connection to Kevin Kuntz. I am strictly a satisfied client who will call on Kevin again whenever I have a job to do.

resp.text: Thank you ma'am, it has been my pleasure helping out with your projects. I appreciate the work and the kind words.

text:
The first thing that let me know I had picked the right general contractor was Jordan Latimer’s attention to detail. Other GC’s weren’t willing to take the extra measurements, or recommend quality parts, or go the extra mile to make sure this project was done right.
When the renovation process began, he communicated the process every step of the way. He let me know where there were issues and promptly set about fixing them with almost no time lost. He helped me achieve my vision for this bathroom and shower remodel and brought in a team of specialists and experts to see it through to completion. He does nothing halfway and values your input too, instead of overriding your ideas. I have gotten to know Jordan a lot during this process, and he is not only a fabulous contractor, but a man of great heart and compassion. He understands people as well as he does home remodeling and does not skimp on either. I cannot reccomend him enough. YOU WILL NEVER NEED ANOTHER CONTRACTOR AGAIN.

resp.text: Thank you Derek! That was very kind of you to say those words. I take a lot of pride in my work and I will never take a shortcut to jeopardize the integrity of a job. It has been wonderful getting to know you and I look forward to the continuing work we have going forward from here. Once again your kind words are very much appreciated.

name: Mark Thimsen
text: Dave is very, very responsive.  We recently had a failing smoke alarm that was going off in our beach rental condo and we had guests there.  It was a Sunday morning and we live 6 hours away so we really needed to get someone quickly over there to take care of the situation.  Dave called me right back and then headed straight to the unit and installed four new smoke detectors for us, per our request.  He did a professional job, used larger cover plates where needed to avoid needing touch up paint, was pleasant to work with, kept us informed, made our guest happy, charged a very fair price and didn't mark up his materials.  Couldn't be happier!  Dave is our new go-to guy.

name: David Lloyd
text:
I am a long time customer of David Stewart and his crew doing business as The Handymen LLC in Foley.  This time I used David and his company for Hurricane Sally repairs.  I was fortunate that I had minor damage to my home.  However, the fact that my damage was not major caused some of the contractors I spoke to to put me off or quote me exorbitant prices to do the work.

The Handymen came out and did roof work one weekend and then David personally came by on a Sunday afternoon and repaired a window for me.  David told me how the job was going to be done and the materials required.  Again, not a huge project but one that required skill, knowledge, and the correct tools.  Of course it turned out well.

I have used this company on two other occasions for exterior work on my townhome.  I know they are licensed in Gulf Shores and have done many projects here.  I have not had to call them out to “repair” their repairs like some of the others that I have used previously.  I have no reservations in recommending The Handymen LLC of Foley to others seeking home repairs.

name: Rachel Holley
text: I originally called Handymen, LLC to remove the carpet in my garden room and to replace it with bamboo tile...Two days before the project began, I cut the carpet and discovered old painted hardwood boards in perfect condition...I sent pictures to David Stewart, the General Contractor, and he didn't mind quickly changing plans so that we could preserve the beauty of these 74 year old floors...The before and after pictures are below...Simply amazing...David Stewart made my dreams come true...His ideas are unique and he tailors everything according to your requests...All work was impeccably done...And David had the proper permits from the City of Mobile...If you have any dreams of what you may want done, David Stewart will make it happen...And all of his work is done to code...He will keep you apprised all along the way as to true expectations in remodeling or repair and pricing...There were no surprises with invoicing...Handymen, LLC will be doing all of my future projects...They are very trustworthy and they clean up after the job is done...The Highest Quality Work I Have Ever Seen...

text: It took about a month for someone to come out to do measurements (started the 2nd week of March). I was told I would be contacted 2 weeks later for an install. I understand this happened at the beginning of the COVID-19 situation and is a hard time for all of us, but I had not received any other communication or follow up from anyone. I had sent text messages on 2 occassions (a month after measurments) and no response. I'm not sure what its like in this line of work, but I was willing to spend close to $3K on the project and not a peep from anyone. This may not seem like a lot of money in this line of work, but $3K for a day or two of work I would be running to complete this job. I'm  concerned about the lack of follow-thru in communication. There are plenty of people that need work and it's disappointing to see the lack of interest.

text:
Couldn't recommend anyone better! (Ask for Ethan!)

I called Birmingham Fast Repair to book a quote and possible appointment to install a pedicure chair's foot rest at my job. They were very fast and informative to book someone for us. They sent an email with a name/photo/bio/contact of who the handyman would be. He followed up the day before and day of (before the appointment).

Upon arrival he was prepared and friendly. He assessed the parts/chair and confidently installed everything exactly as needed and at a timely manner -- I commend him for agreeing to fix it, especially since he had never worked on a pedi chair (who even has?) and it's fairly complex considering there are water lines and pipes involved. He communicated everything very well.

Thank you for everything. We will definitely be recommending you all to everyone we can!

name: Rod Montrose
text: Steve and his crew are great to work with. We've been trying to get our house repaired after Hurricane Sally and never could get a construction person to commit to repairing our house, 3 months after the hurricane. Steve was working next door and the homeowner was very satisfied with his work, so I contacted Steve. He gave me a date when he could start and he started on that date. His guys worked very quickly and repaired our ceilings, flooring, and drywall, along with other touch-ups after the storm. During the work, he communicated with me every day with the progress and included pictures at milestones. They completed when expected and cleaned up, and the project came in at the estimated amount. I would highly recommend Best4Less Handyman Services.
